lead_paragraph: Even with the desire for unity, a New York Times/CBS News poll shows extraordinarily high levels of unpopularity for both Mr. Trump and Hillary Clinton.

byline.contributor: Megan Thee-Brenan and Marina Stefan contributed reporting.
byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and DALIA SUSSMAN

headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Voters Say Trump Deserves Party’s Backing
headline.main: Republicans Want Their Party to Unify Behind Donald Trump, Poll Shows

snippet: Even with the desire for unity, a New York Times/CBS News poll shows extraordinarily high levels of unpopularity for both Mr. Trump and Hillary Clinton.
abstract: New York Times/CBS News poll finds overwhelming majority of Republican voters say party's leaders should rally behind Donald J Trump, even though he has poor favorability ratings among general election voters; poll also indicates Hillary Clinton faces similar unpopularity and misgivings from Democratic voters.
